isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - Engine Electronic Control Module (ECM)

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM is connected to the International electrical system at three points (or four points with antilock brakes installed).

item.para: International engine harness 28-way ECM connector (320) connects to ECM port B. This connector links International sensors, switches and the diagnostic connector to the ECM.

International 21-way connector (312) connects to the Cummins sensor harness. This connector links the International installed key switch circuit, two fan clutch lines, coolant level sensor, A/C refrigerant pressure input, diagnostics test switch, manual fan input, Pulse Width Modulation output, engine ground and control data link to the ECM.
The International power connector (347) connects to the Cummins Actuator harness. This connector supplies the unswitched power to the ECM and provides an ECM ground circuit.
Additionally, with ABS/Traction Control systems, the International 2-way J1922 Data Link connector (535) connects to the 21-way connector (312).

svcsubproc.title: Unswitched Battery Feed And Ground
svcsubproc.para: The ECM receives battery power at all times through International power connector (347). ECM battery power is supplied at all times from the cranking motor B+ terminal. Circuits 97 and 97A deliver power on the International harness through the ECM power connector (347) and the Cummins harness to the ECM. The Cummins harness has a 10A inline fuse in each circuit.

The ECM ground is through the Cummins harness, ECM power harness connector (347) and circuit 97-G to the engine ground stud. The engine ground stud is connected to the cranking motor ground stud, frame rail and negative battery terminal.

svcsubproc.title: Switched Battery Power To ECM
svcsubproc.para: With the ignition key in the IGN position, ignition power from 5A fuse F28 is supplied through the ECM 21-way connector (312) terminal A, to the ECM.
